specifications.definition: The American Hospital Association has issued HIPAA Updated Guidelines for Releasing Information on the Condition of Patients
specifications.label: AHA HIPPA standard

specifications.definition: Information Technology – Codes For The Identification Of The States And Equivalent Areas Within The United States, Puerto Rico, And The Insular Areas
specifications.label: ANSI INCITS 38

specifications.definition: The Darwin Core is body of standards. It includes a glossary of terms (in other contexts these might be called properties, elements, fields, columns, attributes, or concepts) intended to facilitate the sharing of information about biological diversity by providing reference definitions, examples, and commentaries.
specifications.label: Darwin Core Terms

specifications.definition: The GSCID/BRC Project and Sample Application Standard captures standardized human pathogen and vector sequencing metadata to support epidemiologic and genotype-phenotype association studies for human infectious diseases.
specifications.label: GSCID-BRC standard

specifications.definition:
The American HIPPA Protected Health Information (PHI) guidelines cover information, including demographic information, which relates to:

- the individual’s past, present, or future physical or mental health or condition,
- the provision of health care to the individual, or
- the past, present, or future payment for the provision of health care to the individual, and that identifies the individual or for which there is a reasonable basis to believe can be used to identify the individual. Protected health information includes many common identifiers (e.g., name, address, birth date, Social Security Number) when they can be associated with the health information listed above."
specifications.label: HIPPA PHI guidelines

specifications.definition: The INDISC consortium "Minimum data for Matching" standard aims to define a format to capture reads and minimum metadata.  It is developed by the "Repository and storage of sequence and meta-data" workgroup 2.  It is used in the Global Microbial Identifier platform.
specifications.label: INDISC MDM standard

specifications.definition: The International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC) is a long-standing foundational initiative that operates between DDBJ, EMBL-EBI and NCBI. INSDC covers the spectrum of data raw reads, though alignments and assemblies to functional annotation, enriched with contextual information relating to samples and experimental configurations.
specifications.label: INSDC standard

specifications.definition: The Integrated Rapid Infectious Disease Analysis (IRIDA) project is a Canadian-led initiative to build an open source, end-to-end platform for infectious disease genomic epidemiology.
specifications.label: IRIDA standard

specifications.definition: ISO 3166-2 is part of the ISO 3166 standard published by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO), and defines codes for identifying the principal subdivisions (e.g., provinces or states) of all countries coded in ISO 3166-1.
specifications.label: ISO3166-1

specifications.definition: ISO 3166-1 is part of the ISO 3166 standard published by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO), and defines codes for the names of countries, dependent territories, and special areas of geographical interest.
specifications.label: ISO3166-2

specifications.definition: MixS is a unified standard for describing sequence data provided by the Genomic Standards Consortium
specifications.label: MIxS standard

specifications.definition: The National Center for Biotechnology Information offers standards for submitting genomic project data to their BioProject and BioSample databases.
specifications.label: NCBI standard

specifications.definition: United Kingdom National Health Service trusts, boards, etc. have some terminology in common for public disclosure of patient health conditions.
specifications.label: NHS standard

specifications.definition: NIAID provides The GSCID/BRC Project and Sample Application Standard. It is designed to capture standardized human pathogen and vector sequencing metadata to support epidemiologic and genotype-phenotype association studies for human infectious diseases. This standard was developed by representatives of the Genome Sequencing Centers for Infectious Diseases (GSCIDs), the Bioinformatics Resource Centers (BRCs), and NIAID and informed by discussions and input with numerous collaborating scientists.
specifications.label: NIAID standard

specifications.definition: First PFGE pattern from given diagnostic restriction enzyme
specifications.label: PFGE primary test

specifications.definition: Second PFGE pattern from given diagnostic restriction enzyme
specifications.label: PFGE secondary test

specifications.definition: A National Center for Biotechnology Information BioProject is a collection of biological data related to a single initiative, originating from a single organization or from a consortium.  A BioProject record provides users a single place to find links to the diverse data types generated for that project.
specifications.label: NCBI BioProject standard

specifications.definition: A National Center for Biotechnology Information BioSample specification defines fields and terms that provide "descriptions of biological source materials used in experimental assays".
specifications.label: NCBI BioSample standard

specifications.definition: The BCCDC epi case exposure model describes datums related to the possible transmission of a pathogen between a case person and other people, places, animals etc.
specifications.label: BCCDC epi case exposure model

specifications.definition: The BCCDC epi case food model describes datums - like food product type, preservation and cooking characteristics - that are related to one or more foods that a case patient has come in contact with.
specifications.label: BCCDC epi case food model

specifications.definition: A BCCDC epi case general info model contains datum specifications about an epidemiology investigation case including the person involved, contact information and their demographics.
specifications.label: BCCDC epi case general info model

specifications.definition: BCCDC epi case isolate details are the details around how, when, and from what an isolate was extracted.
specifications.label: BCCDC epi case isolate details

specifications.definition: BCCDC epi case tests are laboratory tests performed on specimens from patients.
specifications.label: BCCDC epi case tests

specifications.definition: An epi contact network model - animal provides location and transportation information about an animal that may be involved in transmitting a pathogen.
specifications.label: epi contact network model - animal

specifications.definition: An epi contact network - human is contact information about a person who may be involved in transmitting a pathogen.
specifications.label: epi contact network model - human

specifications.definition: This is a British Columbia Centre for Disease Control model of the datums involved in laboratory processing of whole-genome-sequenced isolates, with respect to data exchange with the IRIDA.ca project.
specifications.label: BCCDC WGS lab test model

specifications.definition: This is a British Columbia Centre for Disease Control model of the datums involved in an epidemiology investigation, with respect to data exchange with the IRIDA.ca project.
specifications.label: BCCDC epidemiology investigation model
BCCDC WGS lab assembly quality metrics
BCCDC WGS lab bioinformatics process model
BCCDC WGS lab sequencing quality metrics

specifications.definition: An epi network contact is a person who may have recieved or transmitted an infectious disease related to an outbreak investigation.
specifications.label: contact specification - epi network contact

specifications.definition: A lab test requestor is the individual or agency requesting that one or more tests be performed on a specimen.
specifications.label: contact specification - lab test requester

specifications.definition: A person who is a principal investigator and provides the specimen
specifications.label: specimen provider principal investigator

specifications.definition: The NCBI BioProject model includes all datums associated with the current NCBI BioProject specification.
specifications.label: NCBI BioProject model

specifications.definition: Geographical origin of the sample; use the appropriate name from this list http://www.insdc.org/documents/country-qualifier-vocabulary. Use a colon to separate the country or ocean from more detailed information about the location, eg "Canada: Vancouver" or "Germany: halfway down Zugspitze, Alps"
specifications.label: NCBI BioSample geo_loc_name model
NCBI BioSample model - mixed clinical and environmental/food/other

specifications.definition: output of CGF
specifications.label: CGF type

specifications.definition: MLST stands for Multilocus Sequence Typing and it is a sequence based typing method that traditionally focused on the sequence of seven housekeeping loci to determine the phylogenetic relationships between strains of the same species. The novel Whole Genome Sequencing (WGS) techniques are bringing new approaches to MLST moving from traditional 7-loci approches to schemas containing up to thousands of genes (see rMLST, wgMLST,cgMLST). Maiden MC, Bygraves JA, Feil E et al. (March 1998). "Multilocus sequence typing: A portable approach to the identification of clones within populations of pathogenic microorganisms". Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U.S.A. 95 (6):3140-3145. doi:10.1073/pnas.95.6.3140. PMC 19708. PMID 9501229.
specifications.label: MLST

specifications.definition: MLVA stands for Multilocus Variable Number of Tandem Repeats Analysis. This method can be performed by three distinct methodologies: by running the amplified locus in a gel , using a capilary electrophoresis apparatus or sequencing the resulting amplified fragment. The first two infer the number of repeats on each locus indirectly by the fragment size.
specifications.label: MLVA

specifications.definition: An integer and character referring to a pattern of opaque or confluent lysis caused by a panel of bacteriophage infections e.g. 14a.
specifications.label: phage type specification

specifications.definition: A container id is an identifier that refers to a container object about a patient specimen. Container ids are referenced in clinical patient records reported to be suspect, or lab test results.
specifications.label: container record

specifications.definition: An identifier moe3l indicates an identifier, the organization it has been issued by, and the status of the identifier - whether it is a primary one, active or archaic.
specifications.label: identifier model

specifications.definition: A line list is a collection of suspected or known disease outbreak cases.  It may also include details about healthy patients associated with an exposure event (picnic, concert etc.) who have been interviewed in order to compare food intake, assess risk factors, etc.  \n\nNote that the health status of people associated with an exposure event can change from healthy or unknown status, to ill patient.
specifications.label: line list object

specifications.definition: A medical health record is a record of a single patient's medical history.
specifications.label: medical health record

specifications.definition: A medical health record is a record of a single patient's medical history.
specifications.label: medical health record (history / timeline)

specifications.definition: A lab test specification indicates the inputs and outputs (results / conclusions) of a test.
specifications.label: test specification

specifications.definition: The British Columbia Centre for Disease Control (BCCDC) model contains data type specifications for whole genome sequencing and epidemiology investigation contextual data as it pertains to data exchange with the IRIDA.ca project.
specifications.label: DRAFT British Columbia CDC - IRIDA model

specifications.definition: The GenEpiO model is a collection of generic data models relevant to epidemiological, laboratory, clinical and environmental pathogen sample data collection and analysis.
specifications.label: GenEpiO model

specifications.definition: A statement that defines conventions, guidelines, characteristics or methods for consistent data handling to facilitate exchange or processing of the data. This set of criteria are reviewed by and agreed upon by the user community or a governing body before they are released and adopted for use.
specifications.label: data standard

specifications.definition: An epidemiology contact network model is a definition of the information necessary to connect pathogen transmission patterns between individuals or animals in connection with an outbreak investigation.
specifications.label: epidemiology contact network model
